medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe unmanageable type V hyperlipoproteinemia with fasting chylomicronemia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has been hypertriglyceridemic for 30 years, suffering four recurrent episodes of acute pancreatitis between the ages of 46 and 49 years. For at least 8 years, he has had documented major type V hyperlipoproteinemia that was refractory to both strict dietary restriction and fibrate treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Heterozygous lipoprotein lipase (LPL) deficiency and unreported nonsense mutation S172fsX179 in the LPL gene.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father had vitiligo, indicating a potential family history of autoimmune disease.
